ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: So much! We just took a test today and I realized that the amount of French knowledge I now have is momentous. We learned negation, conjugation, vocabulary, pronouns - as much as we can learn in only 14 weeks.

I really love how there is a big emphasis on speaking and listening; thanks to French in Action, I got to learn how French people speak in real life to each other (using idioms, etc.) rather than just learning a ton of vocabulary topically unit by unit (which would have been helpful, too, but it wouldn't have actually given me any insight on how to speak normally in a conversation the way French people do). My speaking and listening (as well as grammar) improved immensely!
Introductory French vocabulary, grammar, conversation and composition
The ability construct fairly long sentences in french. I became more particular about french grammar. In addition to studying the language, I got to learn a little more about the French culture.
I expanded my knowledge of the French language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course's strength was how dedicated the faculty is! And the videos called French in Action helped a bunch. A weakness would be how intense it is, but rather than making the course less intense, maybe they should offer more courses beforehand for people who want to take it slow. Just a thought.

I really don't see any weaknesses! Professor Ngame was amazing, and although learning two lessons in one week was sometimes hard and tedious, but the more you practice, the better it is with language learning.

Strength: high level of engagement in a small class, all-round language skill development 

Weakness: I wish grammar was taught in a more focused manner

I think the oral presentations and sketches are very useful in helping students speak the language and learn new vocabulary. And the FiA videos are also quite interesting, and helpful in learning the language.

Weaknesses: we didn't receive our grades back on any assignments except the paper versions of weekly tests, we couldn't ask questions in class because the Professor was upset when we didn't understand concepts, there wasn't enough explanation of grammar concepts in class, pretty much you have to teach yourself French if you even want to pass this class because the organization of it is poor, the FiA videos are dated and confusing, and the teacher in class doesn't provide any type of student support
I enjoyed the videos aspect. I did not enjoy daily workbook homework.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would only recommend this to another student if the student really wanted to learn French. This course is only for people who are passionate about the language, because it is really intense. If you want to learn French, this is the perfect class to do it.
Yes! Well, if you're planning on learning French from the beginning, this is the only option anyway, but my experience was fantastic!

Yes, definitely.
I think French L1 is stressful, considering you meet every weekday. But it's worth it since you'll be able to fairly speak the language at the end of the course.

I wouldn't recommend taking this course at all; I took it as a Credit/D/Fail and I was still stressed out because we never got the grades back on anything except our weekly tests so it was impossible to know what grade we were making in the course even by the end of the semester. The French in Action videos are not helpful and when you ask questions in class we would get shut down with "We covered this __ weeks ago did you not learn it." (clearly we didn't if we still have questions on it.)
I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn French.
